channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023070128
item.description:
Report E-2023070128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into the one 5 gallon box/bladder bag of pro strip ultra (un3267) releasing 5gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.description:
Report E-2023070119

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pails of DS-9-314 (un3264) and that 3 gallons of product were released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070113
item.description:
Report E-2023070113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: RICHMOND HILL
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, at 05 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Richmond Hill, Georgia regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of Aluma-Brite (Corrosive liquids, toxic, n.o.s., (Hydrofluoric Acid, Hydrochloric Acid, Phosphoric Acid), UN2922, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The release was reportedly due to a loose bung. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The loose bung was tightened and the drum was forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite for proper disposal by the contractors.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE LOADSIDE AREA. PACKAGE TAKEN TO HAZMAT AREA FOR PROCESSING. - DescribePack: CAPS OF INNER BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. CONTENT OF BOTTLES BEGAN TO LEAK OUT AS A RESULT. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO PLASTC BAG TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE IN THE AREA.

item.title: Report X-2023061572
item.description:
Report X-2023061572

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023061572 SequenceEvent: Loose caps caused internal leakage, the box was retrieved and the spill was contained. DescribePack: Loose caps on bottles inside of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to contain the spill and the was package was put into a salvage drum. 2. X-2023061581 SequenceEvent: The package was wet from internal leakage due to the caps on the bottles being loose, the package fell apart before being placed on the non conveyable belt DescribePack: loose caps on the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill was contained and put into a salvage drum. 3. X-2023061583 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking on the NC belt and was pulled off DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to contain and clean up the spill, afterwards all contents were put into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023060797
item.description:
Report E-2023060797

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of UN3266 appeared to be defective and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. HES personnel arrived and assessed the site. The amount of product released was so small, it had only impacted the cardboard box, and the product had already dried, so R+L personnel wanted to ship the product as is. HES personnel identified the cause of the leak as the lids not being properly screwed on. Crews tightened the lids and tested them to see that they did not leak any further

DescribePack: CAP OF PLASTIC PAIL BECAME LOOSE DURING SHIPPING. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: PAIL WAS PLACED INTO A PLASTIC BAG TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE.
